intro: Encabarcenia perezgarciae, commonly known as the Perú velvetleaf, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom during the dry season. It is often found growing in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
